summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List detailing 40 international travel entries for Jeffrey Epstein between 1992 and 2000. The document logs flight dates, times, carriers, and airport codes, providing a timeline of his frequent international movements during this period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The sole individual listed in the travel record, showing numerous international flights between 1992 and 2000.

events.title: Epstein Flight from JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York to London Heathrow, as recorded in the TECS system.

events.title: Epstein Flight from HNL to NRT
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Honolulu International Airport to Narita, Tokyo, as recorded in the TECS system.

events.title: Epstein Flight from LAX to SYD
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Los Angeles International Airport to Kingsford Smith Airport in Sydney, Australia, as recorded in the TECS system.

events.title: Epstein Flight from JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's last recorded flight in this document, traveling from John F. Kennedy International Airport to London Heathrow.

locations: JFK (John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York)
keyFacts: The document records 40 separate international travel entries for Jeffrey Epstein between November 1992 and September 2000.
Frequent destinations include London (LHR), Paris (CDG), and Palm Beach (A523), with trips also recorded to Tokyo, Sydney, and Honolulu.
The travel pattern shows Epstein was a frequent international traveler during the late 1990s, with multiple trips per year.

The document is a TECS (Treasury Enforcement Communications System) Person Encounter List generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection in 2020, indicating law enforcement review of historical travel data.
Flight records show use of various airlines including British Airways (BA), Air France (AF), and United Airlines (UA), as well as private or charter flights (codes like PV, 00).
